items.sentence: Tom is a lifeguard at the local swimming pool.
Tom is a very practical, down-to-earth person.
Tom never took responsibility for his actions.
Tom offered the homeless man something to eat.
Is there any other way we could be doing this?
You\'re a better driver than Tom, aren\'t you?
I can talk about anything with my best friend.
I would like to read some books about Lincoln.
My brother loves taking pictures of mountains.
This book is easy enough for children to read.
Have you seen Tom since he\'s shaved his head?
I had a fight with my older brother yesterday.
I remember my mother teaching me the alphabet.
Before Mary got married, she was much thinner.
Can you describe the man who took your wallet?
Can you give an exact report of what happened?
Can you tell me when the next bus will arrive?
Children are easily influenced by advertising.
Convincing Tom to do the right thing was hard.
Tom and Mary volunteered to clean up the park.
Tom asked Mary if he could borrow her bicycle.
Tom certainly appeared to be enjoying himself.
Tom committed crimes, but was never convicted.
Let\'s not forget the real reason we\'re here.
Tom is three months behind in paying his rent.
Tom is very highly strung and easily offended.

Tom usually sits in the back of the classroom.

I\'ve been working here for a couple of years.
I\'ve never heard you complain about anything.

I wish I\'d known that Tom could speak French.
I wish I\'d studied French when I was younger.
